main event: Sighting of an unidentified flying object near Avoca, Wisconsin on October 8, 1960.
interesting points: The object was described as being oblong or oval in shape, with a horizontal row of colored lights (red and green) along the middle section.
The object was observed for about 10 minutes and at times appeared to change course and altitude.
The document mentions that the sighting was reported by multiple witnesses, including the person who wrote the report.
The report indicates that the sighting was classified as an 'unexplained aerial phenomenon'.
The document also contains a response from the Air Force Public Information Division regarding 'window or shatter' material, which may be related to the sighting.
